column4: I have had a LOT of good luck with Spinrite.  I have used it to recover data on everthing from zip disks to hard drives.  It gives a real good indicator on the health of the drive as well.  I have ruled out hard drive problems that were actually controller problems using it as well.  It is pricey at $90, but when it works, it is worth it.  If it doesn't help, they have a 100% money back guarantee, I think.
i'm not interested in recovering the data. i just erased the partition table :p. i just want to check the drive for defects to see if it's useable.
I know.  It does that as well, somewhat definitively.
it exercises every sector and block on the desk, so you can be sure that the thing is good, bad or dieing.
